issue.title: Crashes with latest ESLint (`6.0.0-alpha.1`)

repository.name: eslint-plugin-import
repository.description: ESLint plugin with rules that help validate proper imports.

issue.title: Crashes with latest ESLint version (`6.0.0-alpha.1`)

repository.name: eslint-plugin-html
repository.description: An ESLint plugin to extract and lint scripts from HTML files.

body: Hi, thanks for the report. What happens if you use `node` to open a Node REPL in your project's directory, and then run `require('eslint-plugin-import')`?

Thank you for your report!

At a glance, the reason is that those plugins import internal files like https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/src/ExportMap.js#L7.

(Sorry, I have not seen details because I'm on mobile now)
@mysticatea where would `SourceCode` be available in eslint 6?
You can use `require('eslint').SourceCode`. (This also works in earlier versions of ESLint.)

As an aside, if this is caused by `eslint-plugin-import` trying to load ESLint's internal files, then we still have a bug in the error message (it shouldn't use the "plugin-missing" error message, and should instead just output a stack trace).

However, I can't reproduce this bug locally.
If that works down to eslint 2, then I can certainly switch the import plugin to use the public mechanism :-)
Yes, as far as I can tell it does work down to ESLint 2 (see [here](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/v2.0.0/lib/api.js)).

I'm on PC.

I could reproduce it, but it was caused by importing an internal file of ESLint.

The error was: `Cannot find module 'eslint/lib/util/glob-util'` ([src/rules/no-unused-modules.js#L11-L17](https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/2f85fbea4c4eb498f8fcd7c797690cac0ba725b8/src/rules/no-unused-modules.js#L11-L17))

Because the `eslint/lib/util/glob-utils.js` has been removed entirely. It was replaced by `eslint/lib/cli-engine/file-enumerator.js` in order to load config files before resolving globs. (But it's still private stuff.)
Thanks; Ill look into replacing that one too.

I will do:

- Make an RFC to expose `iterateFiles(patterns)` or something like.
- Fix the wrong `plugin-missing` error.

rename.from: ESLint `6.0.0-alpha.1` crashes when loading some plugins
rename.to: ESLint `6.0.0-alpha.1` has a confusing error message for some plugins that crash on load
